result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer M Slaske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: -To any other sentence if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff 
 Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

-Attend parenting class. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and 
 in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

10:42 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder under supervision of Atty Nickolie.
Defendant Jennifer M Slaske in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Jennifer M Slaske. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Counts 2 and 3. 

Court orders the following:
1 YEAR  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
Consecutive to any other sentence if revoked
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 3 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 Parenting Class
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
